channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What to know about protecting your cat from bird flu
item.description: A few cats have died from bird flu after eating raw food. And some raw pet food products have been recalled. Here's what to know about the risks to your fur babies, and how to keep them safe.
item.content:encoded:
A few cats have died from bird flu after eating raw food. And some raw pet food products have been recalled. Here's what to know about the risks to your fur babies, and how to keep them safe.

(Image credit: eclipse_images/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Prince Harry settles with Murdoch's British tabloids as trial is about to begin
item.description: Prince Harry has agreed to settle his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's British tabloids. The deal ends a years' long battle to hold the newspapers accountable for invasions of privacy.
item.content:encoded:
Prince Harry has agreed to settle his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's British tabloids. The deal ends a years' long battle to hold the newspapers accountable for invasions of privacy.

(Image credit: Frank Augstein/AP)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Fire risk and strong winds continue in Southern California with rain on the horizon
item.description: Southern California was forecast to face more dangerous winds on Wednesday, but could get some badly needed rain this weekend, which could create new challenges like toxic ash runoff.
item.content:encoded:
Southern California was forecast to face more dangerous winds on Wednesday, but could get some badly needed rain this weekend, which could create new challenges like toxic ash runoff.

(Image credit: Gregory Bull)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Harvard agrees to adopt a broad definition of antisemitism to settle two lawsuits
item.description: Several other schools have recently settled similar lawsuits, and suits are pending against others, including the University of Pennsylvania and Columbia University.
item.content:encoded:
Several other schools have recently settled similar lawsuits, and suits are pending against others, including the University of Pennsylvania and Columbia University.

(Image credit: Steven Senne)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Ukraine says Russia hunts civilians with attack drones in the front-line city Kherson
item.description: Ukrainian officials say Russia is using drones to target civilians in Kherson. Some Russian soldiers appear to be bragging about the deadly attacks on social media.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian officials say Russia is using drones to target civilians in Kherson. Some Russian soldiers appear to be bragging about the deadly attacks on social media.

(Image credit: Anton Shtuka for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Rebuilding Gaza will be a massive project. Here are 5 things to know
item.description: After more than 15 months of relentless Israeli bombardment, Gaza has been left in ruins. If last week's ceasefire holds, rebuilding could take decades, cost tens of billions of dollars and present overwhelming obstacles.
item.content:encoded:
After more than 15 months of relentless Israeli bombardment, Gaza has been left in ruins. If last week's ceasefire holds, rebuilding could take decades, cost tens of billions of dollars and present overwhelming obstacles.

(Image credit: Omar Al-Qattaa)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Doug Collins, Trump's nominee to lead the VA, vows to work across the aisle to help vets
item.description: Senators from both parties did push Collins about how he will solve problems that have plagued the VA for decades, like delivering timely health care and protecting whistle-blowers.
item.content:encoded:
Senators from both parties did push Collins about how he will solve problems that have plagued the VA for decades, like delivering timely health care and protecting whistle-blowers.

(Image credit: Nathan Posner)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Some Trump voters express reservations with his sweeping Jan. 6 pardons
item.description: One Trump voter told NPR he supported pardons related to the Capitol attack, but has a tougher time reconciling pardons for rioters who were violent with police.
item.content:encoded:
One Trump voter told NPR he supported pardons related to the Capitol attack, but has a tougher time reconciling pardons for rioters who were violent with police.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Trump administration puts federal diversity, equity and inclusion staff on leave
item.description: Employees in the programs will be placed on paid administrative leave. Agencies have the next few days to submit reports on how they are complying with the orders, including plans to fire them.
item.content:encoded:
Employees in the programs will be placed on paid administrative leave. Agencies have the next few days to submit reports on how they are complying with the orders, including plans to fire them.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Trump pardons dark web marketplace creator Ross Ulbricht
item.description: Ulbricht operated the anonymous digital marketplace known as Silk Road when law enforcement arrested him. The pardon fulfills a campaign pledge Trump made to Ulbricht's Libertarian supporters.
item.content:encoded:
Ulbricht operated the anonymous digital marketplace known as Silk Road when law enforcement arrested him. The pardon fulfills a campaign pledge Trump made to Ulbricht's Libertarian supporters.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin
